importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the incident occurred and when the news was reported, indicating the timeline of events and public awareness.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time of the report's publication, reflecting when the public learned about the incident and when official statements were released.

keyTakeAways: A car plowed into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, resulting in one fatality and 13 injuries.
The driver, a 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, fled the scene initially but later turned himself in.
The deceased was identified as Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez, 31, of Washington.
The incident occurred on a Saturday, with emergency responders arriving shortly after the crash.
Neighbors reported hearing explosions and saw a vehicle driving erratically before the crash.
The victims included six adults and eight children, ranging in age from 1 to 17 years old.
One child remains in stable condition in the hospital, while three adult victims are still hospitalized.
A video on X (formerly Twitter) shows the aftermath, with police and firefighters at the scene.
Jocelyn Route, a former school board member and city council member, witnessed the crash and provided firsthand account of the scene and injuries.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She was the only fatality in the incident, and her identification provides a personal and emotional anchor to the story.

namedEntities.name: Jocelyn Route

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided a firsthand, eyewitness account of the crash and its aftermath, adding credibility and local context to the report.

namedEntities.name: 66-year-old Washington, DC man
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure under criminal investigation and is directly linked to the cause and aftermath of the crash.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A car driven by a 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, plowed into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, on a Saturday, killing 31-year-old Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez and injuring 13 others, including six adults and eight children aged 1 to 17. The driver initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in. Witnesses, including former Bladensburg council member Jocelyn Route, reported hearing explosions and seeing a vehicle driving erratically before the crash. Emergency personnel responded quickly, and while one child remains in stable condition, several others are hospitalized. A video on social media platform X shows the aftermath, and criminal charges are pending. The incident has sparked public concern about road safety and driver behavior in residential areas.
title: Driver plows into child’s birthday party in Maryland, killing 1 and injuring 13, turns himself in
